data.title: great loss to motor sport
data.meta_description: News of the death of Lex Davison at Sandown Park has deeply shocked all motoring enthusiasts a[?] "Davo" was one of the most popular drivers with competitors and spectators Australia has ever produced. ...
data.text:
He was a great man, who

raced motor cars for the

love of it, showing a skill

exceeded by few other Aus-

tralian drivers.

His activities in the field

of motoring have been vast

and varied as, besides win-

ning the Australian Grand

Prix four times and the top

Australian motor sport

award—the Confederation

Gold Star in 1957—he

competed in the Le Mans 24

hour race in France and was

part of an Australian team

which took part in the

Monte Carlo Rally. He also

was the first Australian to

ing art so that one day they

would be able to take their

place on the front row of

any grid on any circuit.

This task had been set by

Davison himself so that

after retirement as a driver

he would be able to still

remain active in motor rac-

ing as a team manager and

coach.

Over recent years this

great Australian driver has

returned much to his sport,

inspiring youth with advice

and financial support.

His loss is a great one,

possibly the worst tragedy

ever to occur in Australian

motor sport, and all who

are even remotely connected

with motor sport are sad at

the loss of a great champion

and an even greater man.

Rally team

News that the famous

Eric Carlsson of Sweden

and his wife Pat Moss are

to come to Australia to take

part in a rally here is good

news that will give local

trial competitors a chance

to compete against world

class opposition.

Carlsson is a three time

winner of the world famous

Monte Carlo Rally whilst

his wife, the sister of Stirl-

ing Moss, is the top woman

rally driver in the world

and gained outright third

placing in this year's Monte

Carlo.

Both are to drive Swedish

Saabs in Australia whilst

they are here during May.

Before coming to Aus-

tralia they both will com-

pete in the Swedish Rally

and the Safari Rally in

Africa.

They will take part in the

Acropolis Rally in Greece

after driving in Australia.
